name: Manchester United 1902-1911 Trivia Game | Manchester United | 10 Questions

questions.text: 1902: What division were Manchester United playing in this season?
questions.explanation:
2nd Division.

	When Newton Heath became Manchester United the club was languishing in the 2nd Division. It would be another three years before the club gained promotion to the 1st division.

questions.text: 1903: Who was the first manager in United's history?
questions.explanation:
Ernest Mangnall.

	Under Mangnall, United won two championships in 1908 and 1911, the FA Cup in 1909, and the inaugural FA Charity Shield in 1908. Mangnall resigned in 1912 to join rivals Manchester City.

questions.text: 1904: Where did United sign Charlie Roberts from?
questions.explanation:
Grimsby Town.

	United paid a princely sum of 600 pounds for the half-back, who went on to play 299 times for United and scored 23 goals between 1904-13.

questions.text: 1905: Which of these teams were NOT one of United's opponents in the league this season?
questions.explanation:
Woolwich Arsenal.

	Woolwich Arsenal were playing in the first division in this year, but the two did meet in the FA Cup, with Arsenal winning 3-2. United beat Glossop 4-1 at home, and 2-1 away. Leicester was 4-1 at home and 3-0 away, while Gainsborough was 3-1 at home and a 0-0 draw away.

questions.text: 1906: United were champions of the 2nd Division?
questions.explanation:
False.

	United finished second to Bristol City, with 28 wins out of 38 games.

questions.text: 1907: United paid 200 pounds for this Barnsley full back. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
George Stacey.

	Stacey played for United for seven years and made 266 appearances and scored nine goals in this time.

questions.text: 1908: Which major honour did United win for the first time?
questions.explanation:
1st Division title.

	United won 23 of the 38 games played and beat Aston Villa into second place to lift their first ever League championship.

questions.text: 1909: Who did United beat in the F.A. Cup Final?
questions.explanation:
Bristol City.

	United beat Bristol City 1-0 in the final at Crystal Palace, with the winning goal scored by Sandy Turnbull.

questions.text: 1910: Who did United play in the first ever League game at Old Trafford?
questions.explanation:
Liverpool.

	The game took place on February 19th, 1910 with United losing 4-3. United's previous grounds were North Road 1878-1893 and Bank Street between 1893-1910.

questions.text: 1911: United finished champions for the second time in their history. How many points did they win the League by?
questions.explanation:
One.

	United won the League with 32 points that season (Two points for a win), from Aston Villa in second.
